page.title: 03THE QUALITY OF RURAL LIFE
page.content: There is virtually no ready-made entertainment or diversions for young or old, apart from the obvious exceptions - tv and radio. Young and old therefore have to rely on their own resourcefulness and that of their friends. The nearby villages offer typical activities - clubs, amateur dramatics, fetes, sport, etc. and knowledge of forthcoming events is usually communicated by word of mouth or read in the local Press. Compared with town dwellers, people here know more about wild life and vegetation, and in most households there will be a competent gardener, as evidenced by some superb flower and vegetable gardens.
